intro: Polycarpaea timorensis, commonly known as the Timor polycarpaea, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
